intro: Seseli rigidum, commonly known as rigid seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, unbranched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in dry, rocky soils. Seseli rigidum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
